original: Åkerberg, Edvard Johan Folke, överläkare. Alingsås, f. 7/8/93 i Vanstad, Malmöh. 1., av kyrkoh. Lorens Å. o. Martha Sjöbohm’. G. 20 m. farm. kand. Elsa Hallberg, d. 45. Barn: Stig .f. 24, med. kand., Monica 31. — Stud:ex. i Malmö 13’, med. (kand. i Lund 17, med. lic. i Sthlm 24. Utb. i kir. v. ol. sjukh. i Sthlm o. Gbg 24-33’, bitr. öv iliäk. v. Örebro las. kir. avd. 33-40, överläk. o. styresman v. las. i Alingsås fr. 40. Skr.: div. upps. i kir. discipliner, spec. in. ur in v äg skir.
translated:
Åkerberg, Edvard Johan Folke, chief physician. Alingsås, born 7/8/93 in Vanstad, Malmöh. 1st son of the parish priest Lorens Å. and Martha Sjöbohm. Married in 1920 to Elsa Hallberg, a pharmaceutical graduate, who passed away in 1945. Children: Stig, born in 1924, medical graduate, and Monica, born in 1931. 

Education: Studied in Malmö and passed the student examination in 1913. Medical degree obtained in Lund in 1917, and medical license in Stockholm in 1924. Further training in surgery at various hospitals in Stockholm and Gothenburg from 1924-1933. Assistant chief physician in the surgical department of Örebro County Hospital from 1933-1940, and chief physician and superintendent at the hospital in Alingsås from 1940. 

Author of various papers in surgical disciplines, especially in the area of urinary tract surgery.

structured.name: Åkerberg, Edvard Johan Folke

education.trainingDetails: Various hospitals in Stockholm and Gothenburg

structured.description: Author of various papers in surgical disciplines, especially in the area of urinary tract surgery.
